p: Following an increase in inflammation parameters, a new sample of pleural fluid was taken from the thoracic drainage, with isolation of Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Candida albicans and a new antibiotic therapy was setting with levofloxacin 500 mg, once a day and piperacillin/tazobactam 4,5 g/3 times a day. Death occurred 14 days later due to cardio-circulatory arrest refractory to resuscitation maneuvers. The autopsy was not done because the relatives did not give consent and also because the echocardiogram performed during the resuscitation maneuvers showed that the patient suffered from massive intracardiac coagulation.
